item.title: What matters to me?
item.description: Asking Why am I here? is probably wasting time. It’s like a termite trying to eat a sequoia. It’s too big and carries little action. You’re probably better off asking two other questions: What things matter to me? What things matter to the people I care about? There’s a host of other questions you can (and should) ask. But these are awesome places to start or reset. Begin with either one, then tackle the other one.

item.title: Your chore list

item.title: The glass is empty
item.description: The longer we live, the more apparent our wasted energy and time becomes. The alternative is focus and attention.
